Once you've taken in Gaudi's Familia Sagrada, I seriously suggest stopping by this fantastic fresh seafood restaurant.  They have an incredible selection of seafood delicacies that you can have either fried or grilled.  We had the prawns and razor clams grilled, and clams cooked with a tomato sauce.  They were cooked to perfection.  We also had the salad, which included pickled orange peel which were fantastic. Everything is a la carte, including the bread and butter with garlic, but worth every penny.  We spent 48€ in total including a bottle of wine.In retrospect, we wished we had ordered the two lobsters for 39€.  They looked so good.Keep in mind that this is not a traditional sit down restaurant.  You make your selections at the entrance and they call out your number when it's done. You also bus your own table, but I think all of that just added to the character.
